author: bridge-bot
content: <frozenfire89> https://twitter.com/thefrozenfire/status/1614145957574369282

author: bridge-bot
content: <frozenfire89> FYI, the IPFS interface linked to from ceremony.ethereum.org, /ipfs/bafybeihzogihryvljuwim2vh2n3rqderrkbiaguzu3fq4m4zhjtcm6xb3u, has a tweet sharing widget which uses the text "test KZG Ceremony". I see my contribution indexed by the sequencer, so that version is otherwise seemingly "production".

author: bridge-bot
content:
<frozenfire89> Also, random tidbit:

`watch -n 30 'export KZG_STATE_CID=$(ipfs urlstore add https://seq.ceremony.ethereum.org/info/current_state) && ipfs pin add $KZG_STATE_CID && ipfs files cp -p /ipfs/$KZG_STATE_CID /kzg-ceremony/'`

`watch -n 60 'export KZG_INDEX_CID=$(ipfs files stat /kzg-ceremony --hash); ipfs name publish --key kzg-ceremony /ipfs/${KZG_INDEX_CID}'`

`/ipns/k51qzi5uqu5dk256wdrekuojymv5qto9ve07ntkellqhoqe9dvkdbitpzgogpx`

author: bridge-bot
content: <frozenfire89> I'm indexing the distinct versions of the sequencer state on IPFS, every 30 seconds, and publishing them over IPNS. If anyone wants to analyze the state changes that I've managed to capture over time.

author: bridge-bot
content: <glamperd> > <glamperd>  The IPFS build was from a pre-launch commit that still had that test text. We should rebuild with updated version soon. (re @frozenfire89: FYI, the IPFS interface linked to from ceremony.ethereum.org, /ipfs/bafybeihzogihryvljuwim2vh2n3rqderrkbiaguzu3fq4m4zhjtcm6xb3u, has a tweet sharing widget which uses the text "test KZG Ceremony". I see my contribution indexed by the sequencer, so that version is otherwise seemingly "production".)

author: ryg9705
content: Are contributions included at a constant rate? Like one per 10 minutes, which would put an upper bound on the number of contributions that can be included within 2 months? Of course assuming that the queue stays constantly full.

author: douya6414
content: yes

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> yeah, it seems to be taking 35.6 seconds per contribution on average, so there is a max we can achieve in two months. we will extend the ceremony contribution period beyond 2 months if not everyone has had an opportunity to contribute. to me that means having the queue be empty (or very short) several times

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> i want everyone in our community to feel like they had a fair opportunity to contribute

author: randomishwalk
content:
This is so cool. Must've required a ton of thoughtful planning and work.

And I see the issue I was having now. It didn't even submit and ask for either wallet connection or Github -- IPFS wasn't loading properly! Good reminder to self that IPFS doesn't play nice with a lot of anti-virus / network firewall software out there. It took me so long to figure out that was the issue ðŸ˜†
